text: What is spatial audio? Select one answer.
skills: Refine existing audio in a Unity project

options.text: Audio that exists at a consistent volume regardless of where the listener is within a scene.
Audio that is “part of the world” of the scene that it’s in; for example, the sound of wind that blows through trees.
Audio that only the user of the application can hear, which is often used to enhance the experience, such as a sound effect attached to a UI button.
Audio that exists in a specific point in 3D space, and will sound different based on the listener’s proximity to the source of the sound.

feedbackCorrect: Spatial audio simulates sounds that exist in a physical space. They originate from a set location, and the sound decays based on the distance and orientation of the listener.
feedbackIncorrect: Spatial audio simulates sounds that exist in a physical space. They originate from a set location, and the sound decays based on the distance and orientation of the listener.
